e5: An ethical reporting policy would be unbiased, transparent, and consistent in presentation of financial information to stakeholders. It should represent a fair and accurate portrayal of the company’s financial condition, enabling investors to make informed decisions. In this scenario, changing to the new no-bias policy promotes ethical behavior by reducing distortions in financial reporting to comply with regulatory requirements and avoid potential legal liability. Adherence to such a policy would also level the playing field among all investors, promoting equity in market transactions.
